title: Drawing, "Design for an Oratory (Memorial Chapel)", ca. 1820
medium: Pen and black ink, brush and gray wash, blue, green and yellow watercolor on  paper
inscribed:
Inscribed in pen and black ink, lower center: Secione dell' Ortografia esterna del grande Oratorio
Indication of scale in pen and black ink at the lower margin
provenance: Giovanni Piancastelli; Mr. and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description:
Design for a round building.  A circular, domed structure without other windows than a skylight at the center of the dome.  The building has a Corinthian portico.  It is flanked on either side by short pergolas and sepulchral monuments; cloudy sky is given as the background.
Scale: in pen and black ink, lower margin
